Primate Biology at Davis, California.
During the past 12 months, 266 projects were completed.
A number of articles were featured in The Oregonian.
A news team from KGW-TV filmed Dr. Montagna and
Dr. Adachi during an interview on their research on bald-
ness. Writers from Fortune magazine interviewed Drs. Goy
and Phoenix on contributions to the understanding of sex
differences coming from the field of endocrinology. The
article appeared in the February 1971 issue of Fortune.
Numerous tours were conducted during the year for
civic and scientific groups.
THE PRIMATE NEWS
Claire E. Lyon et al.
About 1650 copies were mailed monthly to employees,
friends of the Center, business and government leaders,
scientists, teachers, and libraries; almost 200 copies were
mailed to foreign countries.
An inventory of extra copies of back issues was com-
piled; these issues are now mailed whenever possible in
answer to requests for information on the Center.
